summary: More than 10 million Americans age 65 and older live with a cognitive impairment, such as Alzheimer's disease. Medicare offers a service in which health care providers diagnose cognitive impairments and develop a plan to manage them. Use of the service tripled from 2018-2022. title: Medicare Cognitive Assessments: Utilization Tripled between 2018 and 2022, but Challenges Remain
